children.name: far a2
children.definition: far a long distance - use this especially innegativesandquestions: xa
examples: have you driven far?
we won’t be able to go much farther because of the snow
who do you think can jump the farthest?
far from
cleveland isn’t very far from here.
we were sitting too far from the stage to hear what the actors were saying.
far above/below/behind etc
i was now far behind the others and knew i couldn’t catch up.

children.name: far away a2
children.definition: far away a very long distance from where you are: cách xa
examples: the ship was so far away that we could hardly see it.
far away from
she wanted to get as far away from new york as possible.
as far away as sthcách xa như
because of the snowstorm on the east coast, flights for boston were sent as far away as montreal.
from far awaytừ nơi xa
thousands of people had come from far away for a chance to see the pope.

children.name: a long way b1
children.definition: a long way/ a long waysus spoken  a long distance: cách một khoảng xa
examples: you must be tired - you’ve come a long way.
a long way from
the farm is a long way from the highway.
a long way away/a long way offa long way from where you are now or from the place you are talking about cách một khoảng xa so với
we could hear them shouting from a long way away.
from the map, it looked as if the lake was still a long way off.
a long way ahead/below/behind etc
it’s a long way down - hold on tight.

children.name: miles c1
children.definition: milesinformala very long way: hàng dặm
examples: we hiked miles yesterday.
miles awayxa hàng dặm
i don’t see jane much any more - she lives miles away.
miles fromxa hàng dặm từ
the hotel is miles from the station - i’ll come and get you.
miles from anywherea long way from the nearest town ở một nơi xa xôi hẻo lánh
they live up in the mountains, miles from anywhere.
miles and mileshàng dặm
around here you can walk miles and miles and never see anyone.

children.name: nowhere near c1
children.definition: nowhere near a very long way from somewhere, further than youexpectto be, or further thansbelsesaysyou are: còn lâu mới tới
examples: the car was parked in the middle of the street, nowhere near the curb.
after eight hours climbing, we were still nowhere near the top of the mountain.

children.name: a fair way b1
children.definition: a fair way/ quite a way/ a good wayuk alsoquite a waysusspoken fairly far, used especially to warn someone that a distance is longer than they think: khoảng khá xa
examples: look at the map. it’s a fair way to drive in one day.
the children will have to walk quite a way if we take them into the woods.

children.name: some distance b1
children.definition: some distance/quite a distance/a good distance further than usual or further than you expected: khoảng kha khá
examples: josé accompanied us for some distance until we reached the highway.
their house is actually quite a distance from the edge of town.

children.name: far afield x
children.definition: far afield formal if you travel far afield, you travel a very long way from the place where you usually live: (đi) quá
examples: with the car they could travel far afield each summer.as far afield as something
his work took him as far afield as moscow and delhi.
further/ farther afield
the next day we ventured farther afield and sailed out to one of the islands.

children.name: when sth you can see or hear is far away
in the distance b2
children.definition: in the distance if you can see or hear something in the distance, it is a long way from where you are, so it lookssmallor does not sound loud: từ đằng xa
examples: in the distance, he could see the tall chimneys of the factory.
dogs were barking somewhere in the distance.

children.name: distant b2
children.definition: distant especiallywrittena distant thing or noise is very far away, so that it looks small or sounds quiet: từ đằng xa
examples: by now, the plane was just a distant speck in the sky.
there was a flash of lightning and then the rumble of distant thunder.

children.name: on the horizon c2
children.definition: on the horizon at the place far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky: xa tận chân trời
examples: another ship appeared on the horizon.
storm clouds on the horizon were rapidly blowing in our direction.

children.name: from a distance b2
children.definition: from/at a distance from a place that is a fairly long way away: từ đằng xa
examples: from a distance, the two birds look similar.
he followed her at a distance, making sure she didn’t see him.

children.name: a long way off b1
children.definition: a long way off/ far off/ far away in a place very far from where you are now, so that it is difficult to see or hear what is there: từ tít xa
examples: then, from a long way off, i heard high-pitched laughing.
there was a sound of a car backfiring far off in the night.
far away, to the east, you can just see the spire of the cathedral.

children.name: way off b1
children.definition: way off us far from where you are: từ xa
examples: he could hear voices from way off in another part of the house.
way off in the distance i could see a light shining.

children.name: distant b2
children.definition: distant a distanttownorcountryis a long way from where you are: xa xôi
examples: how can we send our young men off to distant lands to die in foreign wars?
far-off[usually attri] a far-offtownorcountryis a long way from where you are: xa xôi
food at the fair comes from such far-off places as brazil and lithuania.

children.name: remote b2
children.definition: remote remote places are far away from other places or people, and very few people go there: xa xôi hẻo lánh
examples: they moved to a remote farmhouse in north wales.
the helicopter crashed in a remote desert area.

children.name: faraway c2
children.definition: faraway written a faraway country, especially one that you have been told about or have read about, is very far away, and different from your own country: xa xôi
examples: ed told us stories of all the faraway countries he had visited.
avis always dreamed of an exotic vacation in some faraway place.

children.name: isolated c1
children.definition: isolated a long way from other towns, buildings, or people, especially in a quiet place where you are alone: biệt lập
examples: if you travel to isolated areas, make sure you have a good guide.
the area is extremely isolated because of the hills that surround it.
isolation[u]
the community was protected from change by its isolation because it was isolated.

children.name: secluded c2
children.definition: secluded a secluded place is private and quiet because it is a long way from other people - use this about a place where people can do what they want without being disturbed: vắng vẻ, hẻo lánh
examples: they drove to a secluded spot in the country to have their picnic.
we rented a little cabin on the edge of a secluded lake.

children.name: in the middle of nowhere b2
children.definition: in the middle of nowhereinformaldisapproving in a lonely place a long way fromtownsorvillages, where you do not expect to find any houses: ở một nơi xa xôi hẻo lánh
examples: amazingly, we found a really nice motel in the middle of nowhere.
miles from anywhere/ nowhere[pp as adv]informalin a lonely place a long way fromtownsorvillages, where you do not expect to find any houses: ở một nơi xa xôi hẻo lánh
we were miles from anywhere and had no idea how to get back.
in the back of beyonduk informal in a lonely place a long way fromtownsorvillages, where you do not expect to find any houses: ở một nơi xa xôi hẻo lánh
they live in some village in the back of beyond.

children.name: in the boondocks x
children.definition: in the boondocks/ boonies us disapproving informal in a part of the country that is a long way from any town: nơi rừng thiên nước độc
examples: i’m not moving to that place - it’s out in the boondocks.
gayle lives out in the boonies - it would take at least an hour to get there.

children.name: out of the way x
children.definition: out of the way fairly far away from any town or from where other people live, and a little difficult to find and travel to: hẻo lánh
examples: the house is a little out of the way, but you should be able to find it.
this must be one of the most out-of-the-way places in scotland.

children.name: off the beaten track c2
children.definition: off the beaten track/off the beaten pathus  a place that is off the beaten track or path is a long way from the places where people usually go, which usually makes it more interesting to visit: xa xôi
examples: the little restaurant was so far off the beaten track that we almost didn’t find it.
greg likes to get off the beaten path and discover places that other tourists don’t find.

children.name: way out x
children.definition: way out a long way from where you are now or far away from the nearest town: xa tít
examples: way out in/ past/ beyond etc
i live way out in laurel canyon.
we drove way out past reno to the old fielding place

children.name: far-flung x
children.definition: far-flung far-flung places are all connected with a particular organization, country etc but they are all very far away from it: bao la
examples: our job is to organize the company’s far-flung offices.
participants come from nations as far-flung as iceland and japan.

children.name: out of reach b2
children.definition: out of reach too far away to pick up or touch: ngoài tầm với
examples: gary jumped for the ball but it was just out of reach.
out of reach of
put the food somewhere out of reach of the dog.
out of sb’s reach/ out of reach of
all medicines should be kept out of children’s reach.

children.name: out of range c2
children.definition: out of range too far away to be hit by a shot from a gun: ngoài phạm vi
examples: we’d better shoot now before the trucks get out of range.
out of range of
villagers are moving south, out of range of enemy gunfire.
